answers.answer: Don't torture your self. You are at a higher risk if you've had it before, but that isn't 100% certain. Eat. Starving yourself is bad for you, bad for baby and will cause many other issues. Eat a healthy diet of mostly whole foods.  Indulge every now and then. Drink lots of water, nearly a gallon a day.  Cut back on things like white bread, white rice and potatoes. Eat high fiber fruit and veggies.

question: I am pregnant with my third baby, through my second pregnancy I had gestational diabetes and I managed to control it with diet. When I explained to my doctor she told me that most probably I will have it this time too and then I will be a diabetic in my 40's!! Can't explain to you how much this news depressed me she told me that on week 6 and i'm almost week 9 now and just crying all the time and starving coz i'm really afraid to eat anything that will cause a high blood sugar.  Has anyone gone through this?!
title: Gestational Diabetes
